parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
A primary particle; opposite, i.e. Instead or because of.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
